title: Sonic CD
notes: Will not start at all regardless of Proton config options.

title: Sonic CD
notes: The game does not start at all. No window.

title: Sonic CD
notes:
WINEPREFIX=(steam library location)/steamapps/compatdata/200940/pfx winetricks d3dcompiler_43 is needed. 
Game will run too fast at >60hz, so need to force to that refresh rate with xrandr or similar.

title: Sonic CD
notes: I tried WINEPREFIX=(steam library location)/steamapps/compatdata/200940/pfx winetricks d3dcompiler_43 but that did not work

title: Sonic CD
notes: Refuses to start after window pops up. Automatically closes after a few seconds.

title: Sonic CD
notes:
Requires the installation of d3dcompiler_43 with winetricks to launch. Game logic is tied to framerate and Vsync is enforced on, use libstrangle to limit the FPS to 60 to get the game to work properly. 
Setup refuses to launch - if you use a resolution with an aspect ratio other than 16:9, you need to a save file created in Windows with a 16:9 aspect ratio selected to avoid stretching. This file is located in <path to your steam folder>/userdata/<your steam id>/200940/local/setup.dat.
Most in-game video filters are broken and seem to produce a blurry mess, setting the filter to "Nostalgia" gives sharp pixels.

gpu: Intel Open Source Technology Center Mesa DRI Intel(R) HD Graphics 530 (Skylake GT2) x86/MMX/SSE2
notes: Game runs perfectly after running "WINEPREFIX=~/.steam/steam/steamapps/compatdata/200940/pfx winetricks d3dcompiler_43" however the video setup doesn't open
title: Sonic CD

gpu: X.Org AMD Radeon (TM) RX 480 Graphics (POLARIS10, DRM 3.26.0, 4.18.7-arch1-1-ARCH, LLVM 8.0.0)
notes: Requires d3dcompiler_43 to run and the video setup doesn't open but the game otherwise works well
title: Sonic CD

gpu: Intel Open Source Technology Center Mesa DRI Intel(R) HD Graphics 630 (Kaby Lake GT2) x86/MMX/SSE2
notes:
I installed Directx9 by wine and then I copied the SYSTEM32 and SYSWOW64 folders that are in
home/.wine/drive_c/windows and put them in home/.steam/steam/steamapps/compatdata/200940/pfx/drive_c/windows

To see the folders in home you have to do Ctrl + H and Done
title: Sonic CD

notes: Game does not launch using Proton 3.16-1, even after installing `d3dcompiler_43` using Winetricks. Worked fine in older versions of Proton.
title: Sonic CD
